abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Institutional Reform and
            Capacity Building Technical Assistance Project for Kenya
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk
            to development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            political environment and public sector reform approach:
            public sector reforms are inherently political and their
            design and implementation has to be informed by a careful
            and ongoing political economy (PE) analysis. Fiscal roles of
            the branches of government and among different levels of
            government are clearly defined in law and practice. Public
            sector and governance reforms affect various interests and
            often face resistance. The design, however, may have
            underestimated the implementation challenges inherent in
            managing such a complex program. While the project design
            adequately identified high level leadership is key to
            successful project implementation, effective leadership at
            component and sub-component levels, is also equally important.
